tourName: Namibia self drive safari, community conservancies
generalInfo: You’ll explore some of Namibia’s most stunning regions, including the Community Conservancies - vast, wildlife-rich areas managed by the very communities who call them home. This approach gives you the chance to meet local people and gain insight into their commitment to protecting their environment. Guided walks and introductions to the region’s unique flora and fauna are at the heart of discovering these incredible, unfenced landscapes. Etosha, Damaraland, and the Namib provide the perfect backdrop to reconnect with nature and truly unwind.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN WINDHOEK Welcome to Namibia! Upon landing at Hosea Kutako International Airport, you will complete immigration and customs formalities and collect your luggage. An English-speaking representative will greet you and accompany you into town to collect your rental vehicle. An English-speaking Ecosafaris representative will then meet you for your vehicle handover and travel briefing. You will check in at your guesthouse and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure. Windhoek offers a variety of charming restaurants for dinner at your own pace. Meals: Lunch and dinner are not included Accommodation: Londiningi Guesthouse

DRIVE TO OTJIWARONGO Approx. 225 km – 2h30 After breakfast, you will begin your journey north. Before leaving Windhoek, we recommend stopping at a supermarket to stock up on supplies for your upcoming camping nights, your vehicle is equipped with a fridge and freezer. This afternoon, you will settle into your campsite at Okonjima, a renowned wildlife sanctuary dedicated to leopard conservation and home to the AfriCat Foundation. Included activity : Leopard tracking with the AfriCat Foundation. Meals: Lunch and dinner are not included Accommodation: Okonjima Campsite

DRIVE TO ETOSHA (SOUTHERN SIDE) Approx. 180 km – 3h30 You will head toward Etosha National Park today, enjoying an extraordinary day of game viewing at your own pace. This area of the park is known for its dramatic landscapes and frequent sightings of big game. Meals: Breakfast, lunch and dinner is not included. Accommodation: Okaukuejo Campsite Fees: Park entry is N$150 per person

FULL DAY IN ETOSHA NATIONAL PARK Today is devoted entirely to wildlife viewing. Etosha’s waterholes attract elephant, lion, giraffe, rhino, zebra, and countless antelope species, making each moment unpredictable and exciting. Meals: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are not included Accommodation: Okaukuejo Campsite

DRIVE TO KAMANJAB After a delicious breakfast prepared by yourself at the camp, depart for your next night's stay at a very unique place in Namibia ; Onjowewe Treehouse. Enjoy the farm style experience, meet the local Himbas, and look out for scorpions at night! Meals: Breakfast and lunch are not included, dinner will be enjoyed at the Treehouse. Accommodation: Onjowewe Treehouse

DRIVE TO TWYFELFONTEIN (DAMARALAND) Approx. 320 km – 3h40 After breakfast, you will travel into the rugged region of Damaraland, famous for its desert-adapted wildlife and striking rock formations. You will settle in at your scenic campsite and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure. Meals: Lunch and dinner are not included Accommodation: Mowani Campsite

TWYFELFONTEIN ROCK ART Today you will discover one of Namibia’s most treasured UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The Twyfelfontein valley hosts thousands of ancient San engravings and paintings, set amongst dramatic red rock formations. It is one of the largest concentrations of rock art in Africa. The remainder of the day is yours to explore at leisure. Meals: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are not included Accommodation: Mowani Campsite

DRIVE TO SPITZKOPPE This morning you will drive to the iconic Spitzkoppe, known as the “Matterhorn of Namibia.” Its granite peaks, natural rock arches, and ancient San artwork make it a haven for photographers and nature lovers. You will have time to explore the site at your own rhythm. Meals: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are not included Accommodation: Spitzkoppe Community Restcamp

DRIVE TO SWAKOPMUND Approx. 160 km – 2h You will reach the charming coastal town of Swakopmund, a fascinating blend of German colonial architecture, palm-lined promenades, and refreshing Atlantic breezes. Enjoy the afternoon exploring cafés, shops, the beach, or simply relaxing. Meals: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are not included Accommodation: Driftwood Guesthouse – Sea View Room

SANDWICH HARBOUR EXPERIENCE After breakfast, you will be collected at 7:15 a.m. for your full-day Sandwich Harbour excursion, one of Namibia’s most breathtaking experiences. Here, the towering dunes of the Namib Desert plunge dramatically into the Atlantic Ocean. Your tour includes a freshly prepared lunch. Enjoy dinner later in town at your leisure. Meals: Breakfast and lunch are included. Dinner is not included. Accommodation: Driftwood Guesthouse – Sea View Room

DRIVE TO SESRIEM Approx. 320 km – 5h You may stop at the Walvis Bay Lagoon on your way south, where flamingos and pelicans often gather in great numbers. Continue through the spectacular Kuiseb Canyon before reaching the small desert settlement of Solitaire. Meals: Lunch and dinner are not included Accommodation: Sesriem Oshana Campsite

SOSSUSVLEI & DEADVLEI Approx. 400 km throughout the day Today you will rise before dawn to enter the Namib-Naukluft Park in time for sunrise—an unforgettable moment as the early light paints the dunes in shades of gold and crimson. You will explore Sossusvlei, Deadvlei, and—if you are adventurous—climb the iconic Big Daddy dune. After your visit, you will continue to the luxurious Zannier Sonop Lodge, a true desert oasis. Meals: Lunch and dinner are included Accommodation: Zannier Sonop

ZANNIER SONOP EXPERIENCE Enjoy a full day discovering the magic of Sonop. Your all-inclusive stay features a curated selection of activities, including: A guided e-bike adventure A horseback exploration of the private reserve A sunset nature drive with sundowner drinks An outdoor “cinema under the stars” Meals: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are included Accommodation: Zannier Sonop

DRIVE TO HELMERINGHAUSEN Approx. 125 km – 2h20 After breakfast, you will begin your journey south-east bound. We recommend stopping to purchase supplies along the way. You will check in at your campsite and enjoy a peaceful afternoon. Meals: Lunch and dinner are not included Accommodation: Mount D’Urban Campsite

DRIVE TO THE KALAHARI DESERT Approx. 270 km – 3h For your last night in Namibia, you will enjoy a night under the stars in the red sands of the Kalahari Desert. Meals: Breakfast, lunch and dinner are not included Accommodation: Kalahari Anib Campsite

DEPARTURE Approx. 290 km – 3h30 After enjoying breakfast at the main lodge, you will drive back to the capital. The rest of the day is yours to explore Windhoek’s shops, cafés, and lively craft market. Return your vehicle to the rental agency. An English-speaking driver will transfer you to Hosea Kutako International Airport for your international flight. We wish you a pleasant return journey and unforgettable memories of Namibia.
